newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Daiwa sees Budapest BUX index at 3,900 at year-end.
newsitem.headline: Daiwa sees Budapest BUX index at 3,900 at year-end.

text.p: Daiwa Europe Ltd said it expected the BUX index of the Budapest Stock Exchange to close at 3,900 points at the end of 1996 and to rise further during 1997.

"Our year-end target for the BUX Index is 3,900, which would bring the market to a price/earnings ratio of 13 times for 1996, but a more reasonable (and much more relevant) 10.5 times for 1997," Daiwa said in its December report.
On December 9 the BUX index closed at 3,754.25 points.

The securities house was bullish on the Budapest bourse, which has been a strong performer in 1996 with a more than 100 percent rise in dollar terms. It said it has raised the proportion of Hungarian stocks within its regional portfolio.
"We have raised our regional allocation to 15 percent (from six percent) and our target for the BUX index for year-end 1997 is 4,500 to 4,800," the report said.
"This market has moved up to new records while Bratislava and Prague have slumped, but we still believe valuation and fundamentals favour Budapest," the report said.
It added, however that it would not rate Budapest's potential as highly as that of Russia.
The securities house was bullish on Hungary on the grounds of expectations of gradually falling interest rates and continuing flow of portfolio funds.
